metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39317 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affected versions of FreeRDP are missing a range check for input offset index in ZGFX decoder. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out of bound data and try to decode it. This issue has been addressed in version 2.9.0. There are no known workarounds for this issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39317` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
freerdp2-wayland - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
freerdp2-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libuwac0-0 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libwinpr2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
winpr-utils - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> malicious server could cause client to crash same commit as CVE-2022-39316

criterions.comment: freerdp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
freerdp2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4').
